title: Twentieth century of deaths
subtitle: Total annual deaths in the United States, broken down by broad category of causes. Non-communicable diseases (NCDs) includes cardiovascular diseases (heart diseases and strokes), cancers, respiratory disease and diabetes. Accidents includes road accidents, falls, fires, drowning, accidential poisonings. The remaining category includes communicable, infectious, neonatal and other non-NCD health conditions.

display.name: Communicable, infectious, neonatal and other deaths
